creator.name: Joe Brewer
creator.bio: I am a change strategist working on behalf of humanity, and also a complexity researcher, cognitive scientist, and evangelist for the field of culture design.

paragraphs.name: 2a97
paragraphs.text: A Life of Depression — How It Prepared Me
I live now for my daughter and the future of humanity.

paragraphs.name: 441b
paragraphs.text: I share this beautiful essay about a life of struggle with severe depression with a personal reflection from my own life…

paragraphs.name: 54ad
paragraphs.text: As a child I was picked on and bullied a lot. During my teenage years, I was suicidal and actively struggled with “bipolar-like” tendencies for a full decade. It was extremely difficult and I honestly didn’t expect to live to see my eighteenth birthday.

paragraphs.name: de80
paragraphs.text: Now I am 41 and have experienced many things that were scarcely imaginable back then. Living with depression and mental anguish is something that doesn’t get talked about nearly enough. It has defined much of my life and is not typically the focus of my writings.

paragraphs.name: d50a
paragraphs.text: Yet there are complications that make this kind of condition even more difficult. On my own journey, I spent nine years engaged in formal academic study at three universities (and an additional 18 years of advanced study done independently beyond the academy) — learning about the many convergent patterns of REAL global crisis that are unfolding around us due to human activities.

paragraphs.name: bfcd
paragraphs.text: It can be very hard to discern what is actually going on with such real-world complexity without having to live with mental anguish (especially considering that the truths of our planetary crisis create the quite-understandable experiences of mental anguish on their own). But I say this in full honesty — it would have been impossible for me to learn how to discern the truths of global warming, mass poverty, political corruption and capture, and all the other topics I work to heal on a daily basis if I hadn’t learned so many skills while coping with my inner demons of depression and suicide early in life.

I will say it plain: It is my history of depression that enabled me to see the world so clearly. It was my training ground as a spiritual warrior that enabled me to do all that I have done to help the world as an adult.

paragraphs.name: 0a1d
paragraphs.text: Several people have written private notes to me in the last year as I have again struggled with suicidal sentiments. My daughter, Elise, is the only reason I continue to breathe and am able to write these words today. She heals me moment to moment and is so beautiful. And I know that she needs me.

paragraphs.name: 0c80
paragraphs.text: By needing me, I continue to live.

paragraphs.name: b512
paragraphs.text: So I say to you… as the world continues to accelerate into intensifying crises of many kinds, how will you learn how to cope? Who will need you so much that you will persist in the pain and struggle so that you can care for and nurture them?

paragraphs.name: 3a8a
paragraphs.text: These are serious questions. I hope they help you as they have helped me.
